deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text: @dev parseAndVerifyVM serves to parse an encodedVM and wholy validate it for consumption

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct Structs.VM2 memory)

documentation.text:
@dev verifySignatures serves to validate arbitrary sigatures against an arbitrary guardianSet
  - it intentionally does not solve for expectations within guardianSet (you should use verifyVM if you need these protections)
  - it intentioanlly does not solve for quorum (you should use verifyVM if you need these protections)
  - it intentionally returns true when signatures is an empty set (you should use verifyVM if you need these protections)

statements.documentation: @dev Obtain the current guardianSet for the guardianSetIndex provided

@dev Checks whether the guardianSet has zero keys
 WARNING: This keys check is critical to ensure the guardianSet has keys present AND to ensure
 that guardianSet key size doesn't fall to zero and negatively impact quorum assessment.  If guardianSet
 key length is 0 and vm.signatures length is 0, this could compromise the integrity of both vm and
 signature verification.
@dev Checks if VM guardian set index matches the current index (unless the current set is expired).

@dev We're using a fixed point number transformation with 1 decimal to deal with rounding.
   WARNING: This quorum check is critical to assessing whether we have enough Guardian signatures to validate a VM
   if making any changes to this, obtain additional peer review. If guardianSet key length is 0 and
   vm.signatures length is 0, this could compromise the integrity of both vm and signature verification.
@dev Verify the proposed vm.signatures against the guardianSet

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes32,struct Structs.Signature memory[] memory,struct Structs.GuardianSet memory) pure returns (bool,string memory)

statements.documentation: If we are here, we've validated the VM is a valid multi-sig that matches the guardianSet.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Structs.VM memory) view returns (bool,string memory)
function (struct Structs.VM memory) view returns (bool,string memory)

documentation.text:
@dev verifyVM serves to validate an arbitrary VM against a valid Guardian set
  - it aims to make sure the VM is for a known guardianSet
  - it aims to ensure the guardianSet is not expired
  - it aims to ensure the VM has reached quorum
  - it aims to verify the signatures provided against the guardianSet
  - it aims to verify VM3s (Headless VMs) by checking the hash against
    an array of previously verified message hashes

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct Structs.Header memory) view returns (bool,string memory)
literal_string "Could not find hash in cache"

components.value: Could not find hash in cache

typeDescriptions.typeString: tuple(bool,literal_string "Could not find hash in cache")
function (struct Structs.Header memory) view returns (bool,string memory)

documentation.text:
@dev verifyBatchVM serves to validate an arbitrary batch of VMs against a valid Guardian set
 - it aims to ensure the VM2 is for a known guardianSet
 - it aims to ensure the guardianSet is not expired
 - it aims to ensure the VM2 has reached quorum
 - it aims to verify the signatures provided against the guardianSet
 - it aims to verify that the guardians have signed the hash of all hashes included in the batch
 - it aims to verify each observation's hash
 - it aims to cache each observation's hash if the `cache` argument is true

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) pure returns (struct Structs.Signature memory[] memory)
function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct Structs.VM memory)
function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct Structs.VM memory)

documentation.text:
@dev parseVM serves to parse an encodedVM into a VM struct
  - it determines the version of the VM by checking the first byte
  - it intentionally performs no validation functions, it simply parses VMs raw into a struct
  - it does not set the signatures or guardianSetIndex for VM3s (Headless VMs)

@dev parseVM2 serves to parse an encodedVM into a VM2 struct
  - it intentionally performs no validation functions, it simply parses raw into a struct
@dev quorum serves solely to determine the number of signatures required to acheive quorum

verifyBatchVM((uint8,uint32,(bytes32,byt.details: verifyBatchVM serves to validate an arbitrary batch of VMs against a valid Guardian set - it aims to ensure the VM2 is for a known guardianSet - it aims to ensure the guardianSet is not expired - it aims to ensure the VM2 has reached quorum - it aims to verify the signatures provided against the guardianSet - it aims to verify that the guardians have signed the hash of all hashes included in the batch - it aims to verify each observation's hash - it aims to cache each observation's hash if the `cache` argument is true

verifySignatures(bytes32,(bytes32,bytes3.details: verifySignatures serves to validate arbitrary sigatures against an arbitrary guardianSet  - it intentionally does not solve for expectations within guardianSet (you should use verifyVM if you need these protections)  - it intentioanlly does not solve for quorum (you should use verifyVM if you need these protections)  - it intentionally returns true when signatures is an empty set (you should use verifyVM if you need these protections)

verifyVM((uint8,uint32,uint32,uint16,byt.details: verifyVM serves to validate an arbitrary VM against a valid Guardian set  - it aims to make sure the VM is for a known guardianSet  - it aims to ensure the guardianSet is not expired  - it aims to ensure the VM has reached quorum  - it aims to verify the signatures provided against the guardianSet  - it aims to verify VM3s (Headless VMs) by checking the hash against    an array of previously verified message hashes
